title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง 2.5 - Proof of identity
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง 2.5 - Proof of identity

State Regulations
(a) When
records are to be made available in person following a request made either in
person or by mail, the department may require appropriate identification such
as a driver's license, an identifier assigned by the department, photographic
identification, or some similar means to confirm the identity of the data
subject. (b) When a request is made
by mail, the department may require that it be acknowledged by a notary public
or other officer, or that an identifier generally known by data subject be
included, or the department may require other similar appropriate
identification. (c) Proof of
identity shall not be required for a record accessible pursuant to the Freedom
of Information Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง
2.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
